author: etaipo
content: is ETH.Build still a good tool for learning, or is it outdated?

author: protolambda
content: <@!243164460636700672> If you want to learn about development on the application layer of ethereum then eth.build should be a great start. If you want to get more in-depth after that, I'd recommend to look at tooling such as Remix (online solidity IDE) and Hardhat (dapp dev environment). This server is mostly focused on protocol engineering however, so maybe try the r/ethdev subreddit or other dapp-focused discords if you're looking to get into dapp development.

author: etaipo
content: ok I'll take a look into those. thanks
